c74object.name: fluid.jit.plotter
c74object.description: An abstraction based on OpenGL that plots data in a two-dimensional graph. Similar to fluid.plotter, but more performant on large datasets.
c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch The fluid.jit.plotter abstraction can be used as a versatile solution for plotting points in a two-dimensional graph.
It is a performance-oriented variant of the fluid.plotter object, based on OpenGL, which allows it to be more efficient and to handle larger datasets (potentially with millions of points).
To use it, use the refer message (left inlet) with the name of a fluid.dataset~ that contains the 2D coordinates of the points. Similarly, you can use the refer message (right inlet) with the name of a fluid.labelset~ to be used for assigning colors to the points based on pre-defined color palettes.
The interface of fluid.jit.plotter is in parity with that of fluid.plotter, offering a drop-in replacement for the latter.
fluid.jit.plotter is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

inlet.digest: Refer to a fluid.dataset~ or highlight points.
inlet.description: Use the refer message with the name of the fluid.dataset~ to be plotted. Alternatively, use the highlight message with a list of identifiers to highlight the corresponding points in the plot.

inlet.digest: Refer to a fluid.labelset~ to be used for assigning colors to the points.
inlet.description: Use the refer message with the name of the fluid.labelset~ to be used for assigning colors to the points.

outlet.description: The position of the mouse will be reported while the mouse is over the plotter and is clicking and dragging. The position is constrained to the domain of the plotter.
Reports any updates made to the plotter view while zooming.

method.name: refer
method.description: In left inlet: refer to the name of a fluid.dataset~ with the coordinates to be plotted. Using the refer message with no arguments will remove the reference and clear the plotter. In right inlet: refer to the name of a fluid.labelset~ with the colors to be used for the points. Using the refer message with no arguments will remove the reference and reset colors to black.

method.name: range
method.digest: Set the x- and y-axis ranges
method.description: Set the x- and y-axis ranges.

method.name: panfactor
method.digest: Set the strengh and direction of the panning
method.description: Set the strength of the panning action when shift-clicking and dragging. Set to a negative value to invert the direction of the panning. Defaults to 1.

method.name: colorscheme
method.description: Change the colour scheme for automatic colouring via a fluid.labelset~. Options are default, cat, accent, dark, paired, tableau, R4, R3, R2, R1, random. Taken mostly from d3-scale-chromatic.

method.name: setpoint
method.digest: Set the position of a point
method.description: Set the point at the given coordinates.

method.name: pointcolor
method.digest: Set the color of a point
method.description: Set the color of the point with a given identifier.

method.name: highlight
method.description: Emphasises the given identifier's points in the plot. Any number of identifiers as a list of symbols can be provided.

method.name: pointsize
method.digest: Set the size of a point
method.description: Set the size of the point with a given identifier.

method.name: pointsizescale
method.digest: Set the overall size of the points
method.description: Set the overall size of the points.

method.name: highlightscale
method.digest: Set the ratio between highlighted and normal point size
method.description: Set the ratio between highlighted and normal point size.

method.name: shape
method.digest: Set the shape of all points
method.description: Modifies the shape of the points. Options are circle or square.

method.name: bgcolor
method.description: Sets the background colour of the plotter.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the graph and all associated data and settings.

method.name: reset
method.description: An alias of clear. Clears the graph.
